intro: Solanum verbascifrons, commonly known as the woolly nightshade, is a flowering plant native to South America. It is a shrub that typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, featuring hairy, glandular leaves that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters, followed by berries that range in color from green to red. Solanum verbascifrons belongs to the nightshade family (Solanaceae), which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. It is often used in traditional medicine and has ecological importance in its native habitat.
